title: Airbnb's Reputational Recovery Post-Discrimination
summary: After high-profile racial discrimination cases by hosts in 2016, Airbnb launched a comprehensive PR and policy campaign — 'Project Lighthouse' — to rebuild trust with diverse communities.
background: Reports of hosts declining bookings based on race and the viral #AirbnbWhileBlack hashtag threatened Airbnb's community-centred brand identity before its planned IPO.
response: Airbnb hired a former attorney general to review policies, introduced anti-discrimination training, launched a 'Project Lighthouse' initiative to measure and reduce bias, and communicated progress transparently.
outcome: The campaign restored stakeholder confidence ahead of Airbnb's 2020 IPO. It is cited as an example of how authentic policy change — communicated effectively — can rebuild trust.
lessons: Acknowledging systemic issues requires systemic solutions
PR and policy change must be aligned
discussion_questions: Could Airbnb have prevented this crisis?
How important was third-party involvement in the recovery?
